title: About
text: Hi there! I’m Jia Yee. I am a data science undergraduate student in the University of Nebraska-Lincoln focusing on Statistical Modeling, Artificial Intelligence, and Data Pipeline. Outside of school, I love exercising and binge watching dramas. Poke around my website to learn more!

title: My CV
text: Data Scientist undergraduate student with <1 years of experience focusing on Statistical Modeling, Artificial Intelligence, and Data Pipeline.

title: My CV
section: Light Rail Transit Database Model | Sep 2024 - Dec 2024
text:
Light Rail Transit Database Model | Sep 2024 - Dec 2024

Developed and implemented a relational database model for a light rail transit system, connecting Omaha and Lincoln, Nebraska
Designed and implemented an optimized SQL schema and developed dynamic queries for practical applications
Collected, transformed, and visualized geospatial data using MATLAB, applying piecewise linear approximations to model train routes, compute distances, and present routes on a geographic map

title: My CV
section: Deep Reinforcement Learning Agent for Pac-Man | Aug 2024 - Dec 2024
text:
Deep Reinforcement Learning Agent for Pac-Man | Aug 2024 - Dec 2024

Developed a Deep-Q-Network (DQN) agent to play Pac-Man, using decision-making to maximize cumulative rewards and gameplay effectiveness
Implemented a convolutional neural network (CNN) to process grayscale images, allowing spatial feature recognition for action selection
Configured the Atari environment for game-state tracking and integrated frame-skip techniques to improve computational efficiency
Monitored model performance using metrics such as average score and win rate to achieve improved gameplay and strategic responsiveness.

title: Thyroid Cancer Prediction
text:
Description: The project utilizes machine learning to predict thyroid cancer risk based on patient data obtained from Kaggle. The datasets were preprocessed by encoding categorical variables and standardizing numerical features. A Random Forest Classifier was trained on an 80-20 train-test split, achieving an 82.45% accuracy. The model’s performance was evaluated using precision, recall, F1-score, and a confusion matrix visualization.



Here is the confusion matrix for the model’s predictions:



Confusion Matrix



View Project on GitHub

title: King County House Sales: Trends & Insights Dashboard
text:
Description: An interactive Tableau dashboard showcasing house sales in King County, Washington, analyzing trends based on the year built, square footage of living space, and square footage of lofts. Users can filter the data by home size, months, and construction year to identify trends in real estate values. The dataset was obtained from mochen862’s GitHub. The dashboard features heatmaps, histograms, and line charts to visualize price variations across different home characteristics. This tool offers insights into the King County housing market, making it useful for home buyers, real estate investors, and analysts.



Here is a screenshot of the dashboard:



Dashboard

title: My Projects
A Valentine’s Day Gift
text:
Description: In celebration of Valentine’s Day, this project generates an animated heart visualization using the Tkinter library. The heart shape is mathematically defined using parametric equations, with additional effects such as diffusion, shrinking, and a halo that create a glowing, scattered appearance.

Here is a screen recording of the animation:


Video
Screen Recording

title: Interactive Coffee Sales Dashboard in Excel
text:
Description: This project features an interactive coffee sales dashboard built in Excel, to efficiently track and analyze coffee bean sales. The dataset was obtained from mochen862’s GitHub. The dashboard incorporates XLOOKUP to retrieve customer data and INDEX MATCH to pull product details, providing accurate and efficient data lookup. It also incorporates Pivot Tables, Slicers, and a Timeline for dynamic filtering, allowing users to explore sales trends seamlessly. These visualizations help businesses optimizeales strategies and better understand customer purchasing behaviors.
Key features include:

Graphs displaying total sales over time, sales by country, and the top 5 customers.
Filters for roast type, product size, and loyalty card status using slicers.
The IF function to rename abbreviations for better readability.


Here is a screenshot of the dashboard and a screen recording of the formula used:



Screenshot




Video
Screen Record



View Project on GitHub

title: Bike Sales: Interactive Dashboard in Excel
text:
Description: This project features an interactive bike sales dashboard built in Excel, designed to analyze and visualize sales data efficiently. The dataset was obtained from AlexTheAnalyst’s GitHub. It incorporates an IF statement to categorize sales data into different ranges, making it easier to interpret. Pivot Tables are used to summarize key metrics, while Slicers allow users to filter data based on various criteria. The dashboard provides clear visualizations, enabling users to effectively explore sales trends and customer preferences.

Here is a screenshot of the dashboard:



Screenshot



View Project on GitHub
